main_definition: In the context of online communication, trackback is a method used to notify another user or website about an incoming link in their blog post.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A notification that one site has received a link from another site
meanings_and_examples.example: Whenever I receive a trackback, it means someone has linked to my latest blog post on TechCrunch.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A reference or commentary on an existing content or post
meanings_and_examples.example: The author's response in the form of a trackback comments specifically on the points raised by another user in their article.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A feature used for tracking changes and updates in online discussions or conversations
meanings_and_examples.example: On our forum, users can send trackbacks to each other when they make significant contributions to a thread.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The automated process of following the link from one website to another within an RSS feed reader
meanings_and_examples.example: My RSS feed reader automatically follows all the trackback links, allowing me to see which blogs are linking back to mine.
